page.title: 08Drovers Rest Monkhill
page.content: The old Inn at Monkhill is called the Drovers' Rest because over the centuries cattle drovers from Scotland, after crossing the rivers Esk and Eden, rested there before moving south to the Fair at Rosley. The Fair was held twice a year when cattle were being taken south to be sold or north in the spring to be fattened. The Inn is over four hundred years old and this year is in the 'Good Beer Guide'. The pub is cosy, being heated by a coal fire; it has original oak beams, provides bar meals and serves 'real ale'. This year a flat has been added in the same style as the original building.
